questions.text: Which of the following accurately describes the evolution of the Internet?
options: A. It began as a small network called ARPANET.
B. It was initially developed for e-commerce.
C. It started as a public network for consumers.
D. It evolved from the World Wide Web.
questions.correctAnswer: A. It began as a small network called ARPANET.
questions.explanation: The Internet began as ARPANET in the late 1960s, primarily used for research and communication between scientists.

questions.text: True or False: ARPANET was the first form of the Internet.
questions.explanation: ARPANET was the precursor to the modern Internet, allowing multiple computers to communicate on a single network.

questions.text: Which of these was a major goal of ARPANET's development?
options: A. To enable commercial transactions online
B. To link military computers in case of an attack
C. To create the first email service
D. To establish the World Wide Web
questions.correctAnswer: B. To link military computers in case of an attack
questions.explanation: ARPANET was developed to ensure communication and data sharing even if parts of the network were destroyed.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the role of the World Wide Web?
options: A. It is a protocol for sending emails.
B. It is a subset of the Internet used for displaying and linking documents.
C. It is a programming language used for web development.
D. It is a type of software used for social media.
questions.correctAnswer: B. It is a subset of the Internet used for displaying and linking documents.
questions.explanation: The World Wide Web is a service of the Internet used for linking and displaying documents using web browsers.

questions.text: True or False: The Internet and the World Wide Web are synonymous terms.
questions.explanation: The Internet is the global network of computers, while the World Wide Web is a service that uses this network to display information.

questions.text: Which of the following is a common type of broadband Internet connection?
questions.explanation: Satellite is a form of broadband Internet that provides high-speed connectivity to remote locations.

questions.text: True or False: DSL (Digital Subscriber Line) uses the existing telephone network for Internet connectivity.
questions.explanation: DSL utilizes the existing copper telephone lines to provide broadband Internet without interrupting phone services.

questions.text: Which broadband technology uses glass or plastic threads to transmit data as light?
questions.explanation: Fiber-optic technology transmits data as light through glass or plastic threads, offering high-speed Internet connections.

questions.text: What is the main advantage of fiber-optic Internet connections?
questions.explanation: Fiber-optic connections offer higher speed and better reliability compared to other broadband technologies.

questions.text: True or False: Cable Internet service is faster than dial-up and uses the same coaxial cables as television.
questions.explanation: Cable Internet is faster than dial-up and utilizes the same coaxial cables that are used for television services.

questions.text: Which of the following is the purpose of an IP address?
options: A. To provide a unique identifier for a device on a network
B. To act as a security key for a computer
D. To connect multiple devices within a LAN
questions.correctAnswer: A. To provide a unique identifier for a device on a network
questions.explanation: An IP address uniquely identifies each device connected to a network, enabling communication and data transfer.

questions.text: True or False: A domain name is a textual representation of an IP address.
questions.explanation: Domain names are human-readable addresses that correspond to numeric IP addresses, making it easier to remember websites.

questions.text: What is the role of a DNS server?
options: A. To assign IP addresses to devices
B. To translate domain names into IP addresses
questions.correctAnswer: B. To translate domain names into IP addresses
questions.explanation: A DNS server translates domain names into their corresponding IP addresses, enabling browsers to locate websites.

questions.text: Which of the following is a valid example of an IP address?
questions.explanation: An IP address is represented in a numeric format like 192.168.1.1, which uniquely identifies devices on a network.

questions.text: True or False: IPv4 is the current standard for IP addresses, but it will be replaced by IPv6.
questions.explanation: IPv4 is currently the most widely used format for IP addresses, but it is being replaced by IPv6 due to the growing number of devices.

questions.text: Which of the following can a web address be used for?
options: A. To find an email address
B. To access a specific webpage
C. To identify a network printer
D. To locate a mobile device
questions.correctAnswer: B. To access a specific webpage
questions.explanation: A web address (URL) is used to locate and access a specific webpage on the World Wide Web.

questions.text: True or False: A search engine helps users locate information based on keywords.
questions.explanation: Search engines like Google or Bing help users locate information on the web based on the keywords they provide.

questions.text: What is a URL?
options: C. A web address used to access a specific page
D. A type of broadband connection
questions.correctAnswer: C. A web address used to access a specific page
questions.explanation: A URL (Uniform Resource Locator) is a web address that specifies the location of a resource on the Internet.

questions.text: Which of the following is part of a URL?
questions.explanation: A URL typically includes a domain name, which is the part that identifies the website being accessed.

questions.text: True or False: A URL can include a file path to specify the location of a file on a server.
questions.explanation: A URL can include a file path to direct users to a specific file within a website or web server.

questions.text: Which of the following types of websites allows users to connect, communicate, and share content with other users?
questions.explanation: Online social networks such as Facebook and LinkedIn allow users to connect, communicate, and share content.

questions.text: True or False: Informational websites are mainly used for e-commerce.
questions.explanation: Informational websites are designed to provide factual information on a variety of topics and are not focused on e-commerce.

questions.text: Which of the following types of websites is designed to help users buy and sell goods online?
questions.explanation: Retail websites like Amazon and eBay are designed specifically for buying and selling goods and services online.

questions.text: Which type of website uses interactive applications to enable real-time communication?
questions.explanation: Chat rooms are websites or applications that use interactive applications for real-time communication between users.

questions.text: True or False: Online forums are used for real-time communication.
questions.explanation: Online forums are used for asynchronous communication, allowing users to post and reply to messages over time.
